info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

get.description: List all the ExpressRoutePort resources in the specified subscription.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRoutePort resources. If there are no ExpressRoutePort resources then an empty list is returned.

get.description: Retrieves all ExpressRoutePort peering locations. Does not return available bandwidths for each location. Available bandwidths can only be obtained when retrieving a specific peering location.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the list of all ExpressRoutePort peering locations.

get.description: Retrieves a single ExpressRoutePort peering location, including the list of available bandwidths available at said peering location.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: locationName
parameters.description: Name of the requested ExpressRoutePort peering location.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the requested ExpressRoutePort peering location.

get.description: List all the ExpressRoutePort resources in the specified resource group.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRoutePort resources. If there are no ExpressRoutePort resources then an empty list is returned.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of ExpressRoutePort.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the requested ExpressRoutePort resource.

put.description: Creates or updates the specified ExpressRoutePort resource.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to the create ExpressRoutePort operation.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRoutePort resource.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRoutePort resource.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Request successful. Resource does not exist.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to update ExpressRoutePort resource tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRoutePort resource.

get.description: Retrieve the ExpressRouteLink sub-resources of the specified ExpressRoutePort resource.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteLink resources. If there are no ExpressRouteLink resources then an empty list is returned.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Client API version.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: expressRoutePortName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

parameters.name: linkName
parameters.description: The name of the ExpressRouteLink resource.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the requested ExpressRouteLink resource.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

name.description: Name of child port resource that is unique among child port resources of the parent.

ExpressRouteLinkListResult.title: ExpressRouteLink List Result

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ExpressRouteLinkListResult.description: Response for ListExpressRouteLinks API service call.

ExpressRouteLinkMacSecConfig.title: Definition of ExpressRouteLink Mac Security configuration.

cakSecretIdentifier.description: Keyvault Secret Identifier URL containing Mac security CAK key.

cknSecretIdentifier.description: Keyvault Secret Identifier URL containing Mac security CKN key.

adminState.description: Administrative state of the physical port.

patchPanelId.description: Mapping between physical port to patch panel port.

rackId.description: Mapping of physical patch panel to rack.

routerName.description: Name of Azure router associated with physical port.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

principalId.description: The principal id of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the system assigned identity. This property will only be provided for a system assigned identity.

type.description: The type of identity used for the resource. The type 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned' includes both an implicitly created identity and a set of user assigned identities. The type 'None' will remove any identities from the virtual machine.

clientId.description: The client id of user assigned identity.

principalId.description: The principal id of user assigned identity.

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user identities associated with resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

ExpressRoutePortListResult.title: ExpressRoute Port List Result

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

ExpressRoutePortListResult.description: Response for ListExpressRoutePorts API service call.

allocationDate.description: Date of the physical port allocation to be used in Letter of Authorization.

bandwidthInGbps.description: Bandwidth of procured ports in Gbps.

circuits.description: Reference the ExpressRoute circuit(s) that are provisioned on this ExpressRoutePort resource.

etherType.description: Ether type of the physical port.

links.title: ExpressRouteLink Sub-Resources
links.description: The set of physical links of the ExpressRoutePort resource.

mtu.description: Maximum transmission unit of the physical port pair(s).

peeringLocation.description: The name of the peering location that the ExpressRoutePort is mapped to physically.

provisionedBandwidthInGbps.description: Aggregate Gbps of associated circuit bandwidths.

resourceGuid.description: The resource GUID property of the express route port resource.

ExpressRoutePortsLocation.description: Definition of the ExpressRoutePorts peering location resource.

ExpressRoutePortsLocationBandwidths.title: ExpressRoutePorts Location Bandwidths
ExpressRoutePortsLocationBandwidths.description: Real-time inventory of available ExpressRoute port bandwidths.

ExpressRoutePortsLocationListResult.title: ExpressRoutePorts Location List Result

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

value.description: The list of all ExpressRoutePort peering locations.

ExpressRoutePortsLocationListResult.description: Response for ListExpressRoutePortsLocations API service call.

ExpressRoutePortsLocationPropertiesForma.title: ExpressRoutePorts Location Properties

availableBandwidths.description: The inventory of available ExpressRoutePort bandwidths.

ExpressRoutePortsLocationPropertiesForma.description: Properties specific to ExpressRoutePorts peering location resources.
